paper_abstract: This paper proposes the use of Selective Acknowledgements (SACK) from clients to services as a method for reducing the memory footprint of replicated services. The paper discusses the general concept of SACK in replicated services and presents a specific implementation of SACK for an existing replication infrastructure. Performance measurements exhibiting the effectiveness of SACK are also presented.
paper_title: Using selective acknowledgements to reduce the memory footprint of replicated services
